text.section: Except as provided in subsection (b)(25) of this section, a requirement of this section does not apply to any continuing care agreement entered into before the effective date of the requirement.
A subscriber's accommodations may be changed only to protect the health or safety of the subscriber or the general and economic welfare of other residents.
A continuing care agreement may contain, in a form acceptable to the Department, any other appropriate provision to effectuate the purpose of the agreement.

section.section:
This subsection applies if:
a provider's continuing care agreement includes a provision to provide assisted living program services; and
the provider does not execute a separate assisted living agreement.
